title: Spike in exploitation of vulnerable people as court removes hundreds of 'guardians'
text:
Hundreds of vulnerable people are being exploited by “deputies” every year, as experts call for an overhaul of the easily-exploited system.

Powers were stripped from more than 400 deputies to the end of June this year, with court orders up 45pc over the past five years, according to the latest figures from the Office of the Public Guardian.

Many cases involve instances of financial abuse, where deputies – appointed by the Court of Protection to manage someone’s affairs if they have lost the capacity to do it themselves – take advantage of their position.
